title: Cops bust gang that brought 50 tonnes of drugs onto streets of Britain
text:
The National Crime Agency (NCA) say the drugs they seized had a total street value of £38 million (Picture: PA)

Police carried out dawn raids across the country to bust a drugs operation worth billions of pounds.

The National Crime Agency said 13 men aged between 24 and 59 were held on Tuesday in London, Manchester, Stockport, St Helens, Warrington, Bolton, Dewsbury, and Leeds.

They are accused of being part of the biggest drug smuggling gang that the NCA has ever uncovered.

Investigators found 351 kilos of cocaine, 92 kilos of heroin, 250 kilos of cannabis and 1,850 kilos of hemp/hashish.

The drugs had a total street value of more than £38 million, in three consignments in September 2018.

Subsequent investigations led them to believe that 50 tonnes of drugs worth billions of pounds were imported on numerous occasions between February 2017 and October 2018.

The NCA said the drugs were hidden in lorries carrying vegetables and juice from the Netherlands.

Officers seized 351 kilos of cocaine, 92 kilos of heroin, 250 kilos of cannabis and 1,850 kilos of hemp/hashish (Picture: PA)

The drugs were hidden in lorries carrying vegetables and juice from the Netherlands (Picture: PA)

The truck that was carrying some of the drugs officers seized (Picture: PA)

Jayne Lloyd, NCA Regional Head of Investigations, said: ‘We suspect these men were involved in an industrial-scale operation – the biggest ever uncovered in the UK – bringing in tonnes of deadly drugs that were distributed to crime groups throughout the country.

‘By working closely with partners here and overseas, in particular the Dutch National Police, we believe we have dismantled a well-established drug supply route.’

As part of the same investigation, four men and two women from the Netherlands were arrested in April this year and are awaiting extradition to the UK.

This latest operation is linked to an earlier NCA investigation, where 13 people were jailed after the seizure of more than 100kg of heroin in 2015.
